intro: Pseudocunila, commonly known as the false cunila, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. These plants are typically annual or biennial herbs with slender stems and finely divided leaves. They produce small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels. Pseudocunila species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, often found in grassy areas and disturbed soils. The genus is characterized by its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
